newsitem.title: GREECE: BANK/GREECE TO CUT DEPO FACILITY RATES 30BPS JUL 25.
newsitem.headline: BANK/GREECE TO CUT DEPO FACILITY RATES 30BPS JUL 25.

text.p: The Bank of Greece, the country's central bank, said in a statement that it would slash its basic and floor deposit facility rates by 30 basis points to 11.6 and 9.6 percent respectively, effective July 25.

The central bank cited a 1.0 trillion drachma reduction in interbank surplus liquidity over the last four months which pushed short-term rates up by 100 to 150 basis points and the wider spread between drachma and other EMS currency rates, especially in July .

The Bank of Greece introduced its two-tier depo facility on March 28, 1997. A total of 300 billion drachmas from all credit institutions operating in Greece is absorbed at the basic rate and amounts in excess of 300 billion at the floor rate. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
